description:
$ sudo apt-get build-dep python-nova
$ sudo apt-get install python-virtualenv python2.7-dev

$ ./run_tests.sh
No virtual environment found...create one? (Y/n)
done.
Creating venv... done.
Installing pip in virtualenv... done.
Installing dependencies with pip (this can take a while)...
Downloading/unpacking greenlet
  Downloading greenlet-0.3.1.tar.gz
...
building 'M2Crypto.__m2crypto' extension

swigging SWIG/_m2crypto.i to SWIG/_m2crypto_wrap.c

swig -python -I/usr/include/python2.7 -I/usr/include -includeall -o SWIG/_m2crypto_wrap.c SWIG/_m2crypto.i

unable to execute swig: No such file or directory

error: command 'swig' failed with exit status 1

----------------------------------------
Command /home/ubuntu/nova/nova/.nova-venv/bin/python -c "import setuptools;__file__='/home/ubuntu/nova/nova/.nova-venv/build/M2Crypto/setup.py';exec(compile(open(__file__).read().replace('\r\n', '\n'), __file__, 'exec'))" install --single-version-externally-managed --record /tmp/pip-PcFG2u-record/install-record.txt --install-headers /home/ubuntu/nova/nova/.nova-venv/include/site/python2.7 failed with error code 1
Storing complete log in /home/ubuntu/.pip/pip.log
Command "tools/with_venv.sh pip install -E /home/ubuntu/nova/nova/.nova-venv -r /home/ubuntu/nova/nova/tools/pip-requires" failed.
None
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "run_tests.py", line 67, in <module>
    from nose import config
title: ./run_tests.sh --virtual-env fails on oneiric

comments.content:
$ sudo apt-get build-dep python-nova
$ sudo apt-get install python-virtualenv python2.7-dev

$ ./run_tests.sh
No virtual environment found...create one? (Y/n)
done.
Creating venv... done.
Installing pip in virtualenv... done.
Installing dependencies with pip (this can take a while)...
Downloading/unpacking greenlet
  Downloading greenlet-0.3.1.tar.gz
...
building 'M2Crypto.__m2crypto' extension

swigging SWIG/_m2crypto.i to SWIG/_m2crypto_wrap.c

swig -python -I/usr/include/python2.7 -I/usr/include -includeall -o SWIG/_m2crypto_wrap.c SWIG/_m2crypto.i

unable to execute swig: No such file or directory

error: command 'swig' failed with exit status 1

----------------------------------------
Command /home/ubuntu/nova/nova/.nova-venv/bin/python -c "import setuptools;__file__='/home/ubuntu/nova/nova/.nova-venv/build/M2Crypto/setup.py';exec(compile(open(__file__).read().replace('\r\n', '\n'), __file__, 'exec'))" install --single-version-externally-managed --record /tmp/pip-PcFG2u-record/install-record.txt --install-headers /home/ubuntu/nova/nova/.nova-venv/include/site/python2.7 failed with error code 1
Storing complete log in /home/ubuntu/.pip/pip.log
Command "tools/with_venv.sh pip install -E /home/ubuntu/nova/nova/.nova-venv -r /home/ubuntu/nova/nova/tools/pip-requires" failed.
None
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "run_tests.py", line 67, in <module>
    from nose import config
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~smoser

comments.content:
This issue is fixable with:
=== modified file 'tools/pip-requires'
--- tools/pip-requires	2011-06-30 18:11:03 +0000
+++ tools/pip-requires	2011-07-20 20:44:06 +0000
@@ -1,3 +1,4 @@
+nose
 SQLAlchemy==0.6.3
 pep8==0.6.1
 pylint==0.19
@@ -18,7 +19,6 @@
 wsgiref==0.1.2
 mox==0.5.3
 greenlet==0.3.1
-nose
 bzr
 Twisted>=10.1.0
 PasteDeploy


I'm guessing that one of the virtualenv packages should have declared a dependency on nose and that it did not.
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~smoser

comments.content: Note, with the above, you still fail to run_tests.sh, but you do get further.
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~smoser

comments.content:
After fixing the 'nose' issue, you fail with MCrypto failing to build.  I believe that is related to openssl.

I'm guessing that based on a quick google to find this:
https://trac.macports.org/ticket/25621
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~smoser

comments.content:
I had run into this problem the other day, after following these instructions the error went away.

"
cd <your_src_dir>/nova
sudo apt-get install python-dev swig libssl-dev python-pip
sudo easy_install nose
pip install virtualenv
python tools/install_venv.py
"

found on:
http://nova.openstack.org/devref/development.environment.html#linux-systems
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~alex-meade

comments.content:
Does Alex suggestion fix it for you ?

Also note that Ubuntu-based developers usually use a local nova install (which sets up all dependencies) and "run_tests.sh -N" to use locally-installed packages instead of the virtualenv. One of the benefits of having Ubuntu as a reference distro...
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~ttx
https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~smoser

comments.content: This report is invalid since M2Crypto will deprecated.
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~zyluo
